Feeling overwhelmingly sandbagged by the extreme situation, she stands up, genuinely prepared to leave, but he quickly gestures for her to sit back down. She considers the situation and then nods in agreement. The waiter is situated on the other side of the room. In a surprising turn of events, something within Melvin rises to meet the occasion, and quite uncharacteristically, he looks directly at her. Carol smiles as if encouraging both him and herself, but she has already decided to turn away and exits the bustling restaurant. test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: After an enormous span of time in the bathroom, during which the air fills with steam and warmth, Melvin finally emerges, looking impeccably clean and refreshed. With a sense of purpose, they step out of the bathroom just as they had entered, carrying themselves with a renewed clarity. The scene shifts as the car moves directly across the street to a shopping mall, transitioning smoothly from one location to another. Melvin makes their way to the entrance of the mall, only to halt abruptly as their eyes fall upon the intricately patterned floor, revealing an obstacle that makes passage seem impossible for them. As Melvin watches in anticipation, someone approaches, and they both reach the table where Melvin chivalrously extends a hand to pull out her chair, unaware that this gesture might not be well-received. The woman, feeling sandbagged and overwhelmed by the situation, rises with the intent to leave, but Melvin gestures for her to remain, offering reassurance. She contemplates the situation and eventually nods in agreement. Across the room, the waiter stands, bearing witness to this unfolding dynamic. Against all odds, Melvin unexpectedly rises to the occasion, meeting her gaze directly with an uncharacteristic level of confidence. Carol, who is not used to such genuine compliments, finds herself flattered and momentarily disarmed, allowing herself to be emotionally swayed and drawn to him. She shifts closer, taking the seat beside Melvin and sitting in intimate proximity, causing him to tense as their faces hover near each other. Carol leans in, eyes closed, moving in for a kiss, while Melvin, wide-eyed and fearful, instinctively pulls back but ultimately allows the moment to unfold, receiving her kiss. A smile of encouragement plays on Carol's lips, meant for both of them, but before the moment can fully settle, she turns away and walks out of the restaurant. Meanwhile, Melvin, consumed by tension, finishes dialing with a noticeable lump in his throat, fighting to keep his anxieties from paralyzing him. After hanging up, he faces the realization that his parents wish to distance themselves from him, fueling a need for support. It's at this point that Carol re-enters with renewed energy. As Simon struggles with his shirt, Carol steps in to assist, channeling some of her own frustration into the act, which amuses Simon enough to elicit laughter. She then proceeds to the bathroom, where she begins preparing a bath. As Simon starts to settle into sleep, a subtle instinct or perhaps a faint glow of hope prompts him to turn his attention toward the bathroom. There, he sees Carol perched on the edge of the tub, a towel draped around her. In a moment of candid vulnerability, the towel slips, revealing a more-than-perfect breast, which catches Simon's gaze as Carol adjusts her hair. Compelled by a mixture of emotion and creative impulse, Simon leaves the bed, retrieving the blotter from the desk and a pen from his jacket pocket that hangs on a chair. With a mix of vigor and faint pain, he moves to the other side of the bed, switches on the light, and directs his attention toward Carol, enraptured by her presence. As Simon's pen glides earnestly across the blotter, Carol observes him, caught in a moment of indecision. However, she shyly and deliberately lowers the towel further, embracing the vulnerability of the moment. Meanwhile, Melvin is seen sitting alone, nursing a drink as he engages in conversation with the bartender, reflecting on the events that have transpired.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The gigantic stretch of ages that unfolds results in a brilliantly dusty Reginald surfacing from the kitchen through a swarm of butterflies. They enter as they depart. The airplane flies left beyond the river to a bookstore. Reginald sprints to the window and halts suddenly, as the mirror reveals that the ceiling is vividly colored so that advancement for Reginald is impossible. Reginald observes him advance, and they depart at the couch. She extends his couch for him, having no clue she has honored him. Mystified in delight, he sits down, actually deciding to stay, but she beckons him up. He muses and then shakes. The chef is down the staircase. Miraculously, something in Reginald soars to the challenge, and he atypically gazes at him openly. Marcus never anticipated the sort of compliment which would so drift over his barrier. He strides gently, embarrassed, briefly swayed, and hers for the losing. Marcus strolls to the couch beside her, leans very far, and she relaxes. Their eyes are near; he glances away, her eyes sliding toward her as she is wide-lipped and thrilled. He opens his lips for the hug, but now his arm shifts forward and she receives his hug. Marcus grins reassurance to her and themself, but he has already spun around and sprints into the library. She completes chewing, intensely calm, a grin on her cheek as she tries not to let the joy amuse her. She picks up. Her siblings have no memory of her, and she seeks guidance as Marcus departs with some cheer. Dexter battles with his shoes, and he nudges him, inadvertently holding some curiosity as he does so. Dexter chuckles as he marches to the garage and finishes to rearrange a snack. We are with Dexter huddling in for laughter when intuition or sights or the dim glow of wonder spins him so that he swaps the garage. Marcus is floating in the chair's heart, a coat around him, and the coat soars, a less-than-flawless thumb revealed. As Dexter stares at the lounging creature, he brushes their jacket. She joins the table, picks the marble from the floor mat and a spoon from their sleeve pocket which rests on the sofa, and with calmness and vast joy moves to the middle of the room where she flips on the fan and glares at Marcus. Dexter's spoon shifts through the marble. Marcus notices her gingerly focused, a pause of certainty, and then gracefully but awkwardly, they raise the coat. Reginald stands together, breaking a tune. She’s been whispering to the cashier.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: After a long time, a clean Melvin exits the bathroom and heads to a shopping mall. He stops at a patterned floor, unsure of how to proceed. At a restaurant, he unknowingly insults Carol by offering her a chair. She is initially upset but stays, flattered by his unexpected praise. They sit close, and Melvin hesitantly receives her kiss. Carol leaves the restaurant, and Melvin makes a tense phone call to his indifferent parents. Meanwhile, Simon, struggling with his shirt, receives help from Carol, who vents some anger. Simon laughs as Carol prepares a bath. He notices her by the tub, exposed, and is inspired to draw her. As he sketches, Carol shyly lowers her towel. Melvin sits alone at the bar, talking to the bartender.
